title: Fantastic support
body: Everyone is very kind and helpful they do their best to give you the help and treatment you need. You are made to feel like a person not just a number . I can't praise the doctors, nurses and everyone there enough and thank you from the bottom of my heart for all you are doing to keep us safe and well ❤️❤️

title: Excellent caring service
body: I had a one stop fast track breast clinic appointment today.  The staff were friendly, professional and treated me with kindness and respect.  We are entering very difficult times with the coronavirus pandemic.  There were clear additional hygiene measures in place and enquiries about symptoms made at the reception desk but for these health professionals the 2 metre social distancing is not an option while they are examining and testing patients.  I applaud  their professionalism and kindness at this very stressful time.  Well done Addenbrookes breast clinic.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Truly great experience.
body:
It's eight days now since I had  a full hip replacement.
All I have is compliments for my highly  skilled surgeon and his team
Followed by the great care  from the nurses - pyisio -
X-ray, in fact everyone who had contact with me.
The atmosphere here is bright and very friendly much superior to others,i thank management for that.
You should all be proud of yourselves.
One very happy patient.

author: Jane A Doe
title: public thanks to everyone involved in my cancer treatment and care
body:
I just wanted to publicly thank all of the people who’ve been involved in my cancer treatment and care in the past three years at the Western General Hospital, the Edinburgh Cancer Centre and the Blue Practice, Stockbridge Health Centre, Edinburgh. – over 40 of you!. And, yes, I know I’ve already thanked lots of you personally, but I want to put on record how much I’ve appreciated all you’ve done for me.  
You’ve all been so kind, efficient, good at your jobs, helpful, patient, informative and went to endless trouble to make me feel as ok as I could under often very trying circumstances. You’ve consistently taken into account the stress caused by the seemingly never ending uncertainty, the long waiting times in between tests and results, and cancer treatment. Most of you understand that under these circs the smallest thing can knock you off your trolley! Even though it’s very apparent you are all under a lot of pressures – time, staff shortages, funding, meeting NHS targets etc etc….  
So, I’m so sorry that you’re all having to keep on meeting yet more pressures during the corona virus pandemic. I hope that the Scottish Government is making sure you all have all the safety clothing and equipment you need to keep you fit and healthy. And, if not, who should I contact to make sure this happens?  
So a huge thank you to you all in no particular order,  
Julie – sonographer, Clinical Radiography  
All you lovely receptionists at the Edinburgh Cancer Centre  
Dr Mark and colleagues including all the kindly chaperones, at Oncology O/P, Ann Ferguson Building and the Edinburgh Cancer Centre  
Linda and colleagues, Edinburgh Cancer Centre  
Claire and Jo, Clinical Nurse Specialists  
Anna, Specialist Physiotherapist  
Dr Emma and all those people behind the scenes who I’ll never meet – medical secretaries, pathologists and all the other members of the MDM teams, cleaning staff, catering staff, and everyone else who keeps the Edinburgh Cancer Centre going.  
Dr Peter, Lesley and everyone at reception, and to all those people behind the scenes who I’ll never meet – medical secretaries, cleaners, cleaning staff, catering staff, managers, IT wizards and everyone else who keeps the Blue Practice going.  
With all best wishes for keeping safe.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Caring and efficient
body: As advised by the Government I followed the procedures using the 111 website and then telephone service. It did take a while to speak to an advisor but once I did get through the service was absolutely excellent. Caring, professional and efficient. There is a massive amount of stress on the system at the moment and the staff are doing a wonderful job. Thank you. Keep up the amazing work you do!

title: Great team
body: When I gave birth to my little girl I was very anxious because of my anxiety but the staff was fantastic I had my partner stay the first night then my mum stayed the second night and because I got induced they eased my mind and when I went into labour I had a wonderful person and she was wonderful

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding Practice
body: The Doctors and nurses at this practice are amazing. They work tirelessly always taking the time to listen and provide outstanding care. Yes you may have to wait at reception or have difficulty getting through on the phone but you can always get through and it’s worth the wait to be under the care of the wonderful and knowledgable medical staff. At the end of the day isn’t that the most important thing?

title: Great Freindly Hospital
body: I was a NHS patient, and from personal expeirence ,I found all the staff are  friendly, caring, professional, highly recommended, I wish all of them well  thank you all, for taking care of me.

title: Great practice
body: I have had ongoing symptoms and all bloods have come back normal. My GP has gone above and beyond to get to the bottom of this to help me, and I am so fortunate to have a kind, supportive and understanding GP who genuinely cares about her patients.

author: Borderer
title: Emergency visit for burst appendix
body:
Burst appendix at 86 years old.  
I am an eighty six year old male pensioner and have suffered bouts of severe sickness and diarrhoea over the past two-plus years. Probably because I felt well after vomiting, I did not complain enough. Although several medical checks were made, nothing conclusive was found.  
In early January I suffered another of ever increasing episodes, I developed shaking and shivering. My wife phoned our G.P. who advised phoning 999 immediately. The ambulance arrived within minutes and I was taken to the A. & E. at Borders General Hospital at Melrose.  
I was examined, had several tests and was told that a perforated appendix was suspected. After a C.T. Scan I was taken to theatre at half-past midnight.  
I regained consciousness sometime the next morning in ITU where I remained for the next six days. For most of my stay in ITU I suffered from delirium and must here apologise to the staff who I now realise must have had a tough time coping with my hallucinations. I then went to Ward 7 for a further week and then released to home aided by the Home First Team. The regular daily visits by the nurses along with the visits from the district nurse, who looked after my wound, were really appreciated as was the attention of the Physio Dept.  
Now, after some ten weeks, I am well on the way to complete recovery.  
I must send my thanks to the wonderful treatment and kindness I received from everyone, the ambulance medics, all the many nurses, doctors, surgeons, physiotherapists, porters, cleaners and all the others who helped me in so many ways. I will never forget their cheerfulness and kindness.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: Tiegan
title: Diagnosis for follicular lymphoma
body:
Went to get one of my breasts checked which was absolutely fine, however, they noticed my lymph nodes were up so extensive investigation was done which I was grateful for.  
When we went for the results, I guessed by the look on the doctor’s face it was very bad news. I was completely in shock made even worse by them saying the Macmillan Nurse would be along presently to talk to me. My initial reaction to the way this was all delivered was that I was likely to die. I didn’t at that point know what to think and to be honest really didn’t take much in. I did wake up in the middle of the night and went through to our spare bedroom to cry, it was just so alien.  
However, under the wing of a marvellous haematology consultant I had my fears put to rest and things came back into perspective - it is slow growing non-hodgins and I am ‘watch and wait’. At some appointments, however, I felt I wasn’t getting answers to questions or they were being misinterpreted (only when I was seeing one specific doctor and felt there might be a bit of a language barrier but this happened a few times).  
I did get transferred to the lymphoma clinic at the Churchill Hospital where I have seen several fantastic consultants and feel that I am very lucky to be getting the care I do. One particular consultant that we’ve been very fortunate to see several times explained more in the first consultation with them than anyone else previously.

readBy.name: Oxford University Hospitals NHS foundation Trust Haematology Department
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: kelvin27
title: I now have no-one looking after my foot
body:
I have been in a care home in Portsmouth for the last 17 months and have been seeing the local district nurses for that time. They have regularly come late (ie the wrong day) and sometimes not come at all, without phoning to explain why. My consultant said I was several months behind where I should be because the foot was badly macerated due to these nurses not coming when they should. I am moving from the care home in a couple of weeks so the nurses have just randomly discharged me so I now have no-one looking after my foot. This is truly the worst service I have experienced in 45 years,  
[Happy with 'Nurses']

author: LCCadmin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: We can all eat together
body:
Parent has written that the biggest difference that the Weaning Group has made to their family is knowing "portion sizes and by baby having the same foods (using the suggested recipes) so we can all eat together.  
Tracey has been very encouraging and helpful."

author: LCCadmin
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: More comfortable with trying foods
body: Parent has written that the biggest difference that the Weaning Group has made is being "more comfortable with trying lumpier foods earlier than I did with my first child. "

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Wow what can I say! This practice is absolutely wonderful. I have been registered with you since August last year and the difference between yourself and my last surgery is off the scale. Every member of staff is so helpful and considerate. I can not thank you all enough for the care and compassion you have all shown to myself and my Husband the past two months. You deserve so much recognition and you should all be proud of yourself. Thank you so much.

author: Cbmas
title: Lincoln a&e
body: I had to go to a& e when I really didn't want to during the Coronavirus crisis. After a slightly scary entrance procedure ( completely understandable but put my blood pressure up! ) I was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The staff were so good, friendly, calm and calm and respectful to each other. There are unusual restrictions but they were very calm in the way they dealt with everyone. Well done to the team on site. I hope to now keep myself well so I don't put any more pressure on you and your colleagues. Keep going... you're doing a fantastic job.

title: Amazing service
body:
The GP called me after I asked for an appointment - as expected

We did a video consultation - how cool! All over in 2-3 minutes - I would expect this to continue for the future of medical consultations - no taking time off work, no driving (or parking issues) - no contamination of people - and probably quicker for all.

Shame its taken the CoronaVirus CV-19 to make things move with technology, but I hope this continues for the future

title: thank you
body: I was helped at my appointment. However i am writing to say Thank you to all the staff and drs and nurses for their hard work at the this stressful difficult time.Its not easy for them or us as patients to deal with something on such a gigantic scale. Please can we all be kind to each other and appreciate.

author: Cat 123
title: All the staff here are doing amazing
body:
Well I have been here it have been some ups and downs but  
Being here makes you realise how lucky having people that helps you and cares for you is amazing thing to have but being here helping me understand about how to keep yourself safe and all the staff here I doing amazing keeping people safe and well cared for .  
I have been feeling really positive. And the unit has lots of activities to do on the unit  
And we do baking, games, puzzles, walking, going to parks ,and staff are vary grumpy sometimes. but staff are very good at engaging with us and understanding our feelings and going to miss this place when I going to leave and dowen is very good at keeping this unit clean ,safe,and in good condition and Domin makes people laugh  
And he is good at playing pool having the pool table is been the best thing we had on the unit ,and having people on the unit to call. Shit bag as one person calls them as a joke  
And me. Cow bag when he I loosing or snooker him the pool game .

author: MerAnna
title: Gran in Ward 3C
body: Nurses in this ward treated my gran amazingly well. They consistently show genuine care for my gran and the family. Im so grateful for the care and attention my gran received.

author: Lainie
title: My CBT therapy
body:
I have had depression on and off for years now and last year I went through what can only be described as my worst bout of it yet. I have always said i cant say I suffer with depression because I was still able to live my day to day life. But last year I suffered, I was bedridden sleeping for up to 20 hours a day, I often thought of ending everything and felt useless. My confidence was already low but it hit rock bottom.  
I contacted Inclusion Thurrock and was given an appointment with Jo a CBT therapist. Having had therapy in the past I didn't hold out much hope but I went into this determined to get out of the dark hole I was in and I think that helped so much. I embraced everything that was said and done my homework that Jo gave me.  
I cant thank Jo enough for what she did for me and undoubtedly does for others. I was discharged in Feb 2020 with a relapse plan (which I have never been given in the past) and continue using the tools I was given to get through each day. I can honestly say I have never felt as positive and in control of my mind/feelings as I do now. That is all down to Jo, my saviour.

title: Great response during difficult time
body: Thank you to the reception staff and doctor who responded very quickly to my call on the 19th March. The medication prescribed to me helped me get through a very tough 7 days of potential covid 19 or pneumonia. I am ever so grateful that I didn't have to be rushed to hospital. Finally feeling like I might recover from this. Thank you x

author: Carowils
title: A great team effort supporting staff and patients
body: Thank you to all the staff on ward 204 does not seem adequate. I was admitted this month and diagnosed with pneumonia and influenza, the staff on ward 204 are amazing and I cannot thank them enough for getting me well enough To come home after just a week. No stay in hospital is pleasant but all of the staff were fabulous a great team effort supporting each other and patients. I will forever be indebted to you all and more so during these unprecedented times. God bless you all thank you

readBy.name: Office of Iain Gray, MSP for East Lothian

title: Excellent Care
body: From start to finish which did not take long, was kept fully informed of what was to happen and what was happening during surgery. After surgery looked after by great Professionals. Now this Pandemic has arrived I hope that all their staff stay well and safe.

title: Outstanding practice
body: Outstanding practice in every which way. Attentive, proactive, kind and efficient. Waiting times an issue as everywhere in London, but once an appointment is made, it is always on time and efficient

title: Truly Amazing
body:
To all on Rutland Ward.

Words alone cannot express my thanks for the wonderful help and support you gave to my Father during his time at the Oakham Memorial Hospital.

There was always a smile on everyone's face, a joke to be shared and a laugh to be had.

Thank you so much

author: Molly moo
title: My sons treatment
body: Sent to medway from sittingbourne memorial he was seen by triage even though we were told we would go straight to ear nose and throat, sent to Memorial Hospital A+e in another waiting area where elderly people were waiting in hard chairs after 3 hrs seen by a doctor who was very good said my son needed admission but no beds available, sent back to the waiting room with a cannula for iv antibiotics, no wrist band "! Called into a room given antibiotics without confirmation of name dob, after seven hours sitting a hard chair no blanket or pillow lights on bright nurses calling people all night, my son is 6ft 7 in and was in so much pain and discomfort we made the decision to take him home as he was receiving no care a nurse was doing random bps going from person to person with no hand hygiene, with the beginning of the coronavirus we felt this was unsafe practice, my son was safer at home

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful care
body: We attended the Birthing Unit at the Princess Alexandra Hospital for the recent birth of our first son Samuel. We had an excellent experience at this wonderful hospital, the midwives were professional, compassionate and kind and looked after my wife and son in the best possible manner. We are enormously grateful to them for helping to deliver our baby safely and calmly, for honouring the choices on our birth plan and for the incredible work they do every single day with so many families. They have every reason to be enormously proud of the work that they do.

author: Blownaway by incompetence
title: Medical Staff who don't practice social spacing
body:
I went to East Surrey Hospital on Monday for a pre-booked appointment.  
I was horrified when I saw a group of about nine Matrons at about 8.45am standing close together chatting in the corridor outside of the Operations Centre. I feel this is an appalling example for the public to see.  
Then when I went to the department for my appointment at about 8.50am the reception area was jammed packed with doctors, nurses and admin staff being addressed by the head of the department!!  
Funnily enough I was saved from my appointment when I was told the person carrying out the procedure on me couldn't do it because they hadn't been fitted for a mask!!! Lucky escape.  
What is being done about this in an "Outstanding" Hospital?

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Very responsive and understanding
body: This is the first time I've found a GP practice where the staff and medical team treat you like an actual human. Especially given the very busy period, they were all responsive and helped me in good time. Would highly recommend!

title: Slow responce
body: Waited 3 hours in line yesterday only to be told my prescription was not on the system, got through to surgery to be told it is on the system, back down today now 8.20 and doors are still not open. Queue is getting longer. Why isn't it open on time.

author: Stroke
title: Stroke
body:
I suffered a stroke last year. My after care was excellent and the care received was first class. They were all very helpful and friendly which is a great help. I have been very lucky to have the team, and I cannot speak highly enough. They have been a great help for me and I am extremely grateful for all their help and support.  
This is dedicated at the North Stroke Neuro team at Coathill.  
Thank you so much to Jo, Aileen, Karen and Irene.

title: Leaving this practice - too bad
body:
Made an appointment in advance a few weeks ago.
Have some health conditions and also injured arm.
Arrived 5 minutes prior to appointment.
Waited for over half and hour, meanwhile many people who came later were already seen.
Reminded about myself to the receptionist and after over 40 minutes of waiting since my appointment time was invited to be seen by two medical students with no doctor presence and therefore, without any supervision.
I refused to discuss my private illness matters with the students or had any confidence that they are in the position to check my arm injury.
When asked for the doctor, I was told he is 'busy'..
Left without being seen by the doctor.
Bad planning and bad attitude by the doctor.
After all I am 62 and maybe he could find time to examine me instead being too busy with other patients who  came later than I to the practice and were much younger,
May I suggest that he should do his job instead of delegating it to the students..
Just a thought..

author: Emmrd63
title: Good work
body:
Good work Roisin, you should have a raise and a Christmas bonus and a company car and free petrol...  
Just sayin'

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: guidedk76
title: Home First
body:
I recently had a fall and broke my wrist and hurt my face, my son was very worried about how I would look after myself as he works in the NHS and is extremely busy at the moment with everything going on and he was worried that I might not receive the care I needed straight away.  
However, 24 hours after leaving the hospital he was very reassured as the Home First carers service was extremely helpful and a care package was put in place immediately. They are wonderful people so very caring, I have had around 8 different people visit and help me and they are all so obliging. It isn’t easy coming into another person’s home or having people I don’t know come into my home, but they have all been so obliging and kind. They help me to wash and dress and they lay out my breakfast and other meals for me. I can’t open some things at the moment so they help with that too and they all ask what else they can do to help me.  
Their care has helped relax my son about my care also. With everything going on right now the carer’s ring me before a visit to ask if I have any symptoms of the Coronavirus and have assured me that should I show any signs they will still visit and help me they will just take extra precautions which is very reassuring. I just wanted them to thank them all and show my gratitude giving credit where credit is due.

title: Great practice
body:
This is  a Five star rating  GP surgery, Doctors and All multidisciplinary team members are fantastic in their service provisions. I am using this opportunity to express my sincere gratitude for their kind and caring services.
I am thinking about them and their safety at this Covid-19 challenging times and wishing the government to protect them. Please look after yourselves.

title: Good practice - please share info
body:
Always had good experience for my health issues - thanks 
Just wanted to say the text that was sent out the other day about how to access services now in light of COVID 19 was truncated. As a  clinician could I suggest to send out this link which provides valuable information on the 7 day self isolation - am sure you are thinking of this already but could be a useful text for all patients . Many thanks https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-stay-at-home-guidance/stay-at-home-guidance-for-people-with-confirmed-or-possible-coronavirus-covid-19-infection

author: Tia Louise
title: Endoscopy Unit
body:
I attended for a day case last week, and was very upset by my treatment at Grantham hospitals endoscopy department. Upon arriving, I was told my sister couldn’t even come on the ward with me, despite the fact I have underlying medical problems, and was unable to drive home after my procedure. She was told to either wait in the car or go home and come back. I found the staff very rude, and considering the current situation with the Coronavirus, was outraged that one specific nurse spoke that close to me that I could actually smell their breath.  
I was given the option of 2 gowns to wear, one which had no ties on, the other which had a massive hole near the groin area, meaning people could see my private parts. I tried to get the attention of a nurse regarding this, but they were too busy chatting to even notice me. After an hour of waiting for my procedure I asked how long it would be, as my sister who came with me was waiting in the car. They couldn’t tell me anything. So I waited for two hours for my procedure, without being told by anyone that they were running late ect and was offered no apology. I was told I would have gas and air, and shown how to correctly breath it in ect, however during the procedure was never given any.  
Overall, I was very disappointed by their efforts and hope they can work on this for the sake of other patients.

author: importerqe37
title: Emergency treatment
body:
Over here on holiday from New Zealand I woke up very dizzy, nauseous and fatigue. Had stroke 7 years ago and one TIA episode previously. Called 111 services, appointment made at Helston Community Hospital later in day, lovely Irish doctor checked me and decided I should go straight to Truro after she had spoken with doctor at Truro.  
On arrival at emergency, within 10 minutes I was called by nurse for triage.  
Taken through within another 10 minutes, bloods ecg etc taken, stemital for the nausea. Told a CT scan would be done and I had the CT - this was all carried out so efficiently and in a friendly manner by just about everyone. Perhaps receptionist and triage nurse could have been a little friendlier!  
Finally the registrar and TA nurse came to talk to me. The results were okay but I was told an appointment would be made with a consultant in the TIA clinic within 48 hours and an ultrasound of my cardios would be done and advised on future care. This all happened as advised. Your service is exceptional and i am in the medical profession (or have been, retired now!)

author: slidepc67
title: Really enjoyed the course
body: I really enjoyed the weaning course, before I did it had no idea what to give my baby to wean.   Everyone was so kind too.

author: learninghc86
title: Weaning Group
body:
The course was engaging and the tutor was friendly, explaining things in ways that was understandable. Tracy answered whatever questions that was asked very professionally.  
Attending the group made me feel more confident to try new things with my baby in terms of food.  
It was good so nothing else to add except all the staff at Ravensdale are super nice! and friendly.

author: hydruszh46
title: Helpful Weaning course
body: Really helpful and informative

author: nuthatchyn85
title: Helpful staff
body: Staff very helpful and all great.   Care to patients,   friendly.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: wearingde85
title: The treatment I received was exceptional
body:
Just over 12 months ago I was feeling very poorly and my GP took blood samples from which I was diagnosed with Temporal Arthritis. Initially I was sent to MRI for eye tests etc. and after about 5-6 hours there at 10pm I was told I was not in their postcode. I had to go to A & E at Stockport - on a Friday night. I was feeling ill and refused to go there at night, so I was referred to the ACU at Stepping Hill on the Saturday.  
I spent about 8 hours there and have to say the treatment I received was exceptional, both doctors and staff were excellent. One of the doctors, whose name I forget, was very sympathetic and kind and said I wasn't actually in the Stockport postcode but she would not send me anywhere else and all my treatment would be at Stockport and it has been. the treatment by everyone has been brilliant so thank you. Rheumotology and outpatients have been great too.

title: Dedicated staff
body:
Had an appointment for a flexible cystoscopy. Met at reception by a very pleasant receptionist who told us where to go 
.Another receptionist told us where to sit. I was called in before time and they went though my notes and explained the procedure to me very professional but caring.I was given privacy to undress and everything was done to make me comfortable they  assisted and everything was explained.I watched the whole procedure on a screen and learnt a lot about the bladder.Thank you for being there in the midst of this  coronavirus crisis and carrying on.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Simply Amazing. I am proud of you guys
body: My 80 year old dad fell through his greenhouse on sat 21/03/29 and seriously cut his hand deeply in several places.We were very quickly seen at Exmouth and his wound dressed, due to the wound severity we were advised to go to RD&E (Exeter).I drove my dad to RD&E and left him at reception while parking my car.In the few minutes it took to park his car he was being taken to X ray.He was then rapidly seen by nurses and a lovely doctor who was great with my dad and stitched him up rapidly.As my dad was a little light headed during the stitches,they rightly insisted we stayed under observation.I thank your amazing staff from the bottom of my heart.Allstaff were helpful,caring and had a smile on their faces I wish you all the best and know your amazing work will be saving countless lives,while risking your own, knowing what is to come with Coronavirus. NHS you should be proud of your selves, as I am and the country is with you! Adam Ayres

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Fantastic response
body:
At a time when Covid-19 is putting such pressure on health workers, today's response to my telephone call was excellent. Nurse Practitioner contacted me quickly and arrangements made for antibiotic prescription to be organised.

Thank you for everyone's professional response and efforts.

title: Excellent service
body: Got seen very quickly by lovely very tired staff, thorough examination, medication given 3 days later remembering the dedication and care from these lovely people (including check in desk) I was worried going to A&E because of the Coronavirus but was in so much pain needed help, well done bedford and thank you for everything, feeling so much better you are all amazing grateful thanks Shirley O'Flaherty

title: One amazing team
body:
From 3 - 13 March I was cared for by the Critical Care team at Peterborough Hospital with a life threatening pneumonia.

Throughout this period the  medical attention was of the highest order not only in terms of consultant direction but also the quality of nursing. This was combined with great humanity, compassion and personal support for my family through the anxious stages whilst I was on the ventilator. The patient diary has been a valuable tool in enabling me to comprehend and process the experience. 

 I also thought that the holistic approach to my rehabilitation was excellent. They aimed to help me get back to normal as soon as possible which was both sensitive and very motivating.

 However for me the most extraordinary feature of Critical Care was the team work and passion. The collaborative and ever present consultant team, the patient focussed cross disciplinary working, and the diligence of the healthcare assistants and other support staff. However, I would like to particularly highlight the passion, commitment, unified purpose and unquestioning mutual support within the  nursing team. This standard and consistency, when they are caring for so many different people,  is incredibly hard to achieve and is an enormous credit to all involved. On behalf of myself and my family I would like to say a very big 'thank you' for the care and support we received.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible receptionists
body: Spoke to the receptionists on the phone many times but they can’t seem to bothered to help with my issue, telling me to ‘ring back next week’ at least four weeks in a row when I really ought to be sorted straight away with my therapist and therapist doctor telling me it’s urgent I be delt with straight away. She was so rude and arrogant on the phone has no manners or people skills, when I got off the phone I actually burst into tears with how rude and hostile she was to me. Terrible service which I’m very upset about. Doctors that I have seen are nice and helpful though, the receptionists just need sacking

title: Rude receptionist
body:
Don’t believe a word of the review below saying people are giving the reception staff a hard time. They deserve every bad review on here. They are rude uncaring and should definitely not be working with patients. 

When putting my first repeat prescription through email I specifically asked to be called when they were ready. I then asked my daughter to call and chase if they were ready as I had been given 2 emails that didn’t work the reception staff was shouting down the phone that she didn’t didn’t have time to call patients to tell them their prescriptions are ready. This was all after the GP ensuring I could buy specific supplements in a health shop so spent hours searching for them to be told they needed prescribing. If they had done what was asked on my discharge letter it would have saved me (who is at risk after just having major surgery) from going to multiple pharmacies and health shops looking for a medication that they should have prescribed in the first place. 

I have just had major surgery and my medications are really important to take. Particularly in the current situation your staff need to learn to be a bit more polite and considerate to how patients are feeling. 

I would of thought after multiple bad reviews about your reception staff that you would have given them some training on how to speak to patients. 

Yet again disappointed in this practice.

title: Unbelievably grateful
body: I couldn't move on to radiotherapy after chemo as I had an unusual amount of fluid around my heart. I was given a Pericardial window by you guys - and looked after on the ward. Thank you so much for your amazing work.

author: DBaptistr
title: Overwhelmed with the great service
body: I am feeling truly overwhelmed with the great service that I received today especially with all that is going on you guys are working under pressure but at the same time still being professional and assisting your patients to the best that you can. On behalf of me and my family we want to thank you for all your hard work.

title: Amazing nurses
body:
I was unfortunate enough to need regular visits to this practice following surgery.
The nurses were amazing, knowledgable and professional. The lead nurse was so friendly and put my mind at ease. I can’t praise them enough.

title: Best practice in Bedford
body: The GP’s here are fantastic..very caring and genuinely care about their patients. I had an ongoing illness for some time and thanks to the particular GP I saw I’m now able to live a normal life. He really was the most caring person and always put me at ease. Glad to know that the surgery is still in great hands! Thank you for all of your help. Also the receptionists have always been kind and courteous, they always put a smile on my face! Thank you Linden Road, what a brilliant practice!

title: Amazing staff
body: I visited on an early Saturday morning having fallen down the stairs and broke my collar bone and right. I was seen very quickly and given pain relief immediately and I was xrayed and seen by a doctor and couldn't be more happy with the way I was treated. I have been to fracture clinic a few times since and they are all amazing and helpful and explain everything and answered my concerns.

title: Excellent service
body: I had to visit the Westmorland General Urgent Medical Centre after contracting a rampaging (in the words of the doctor) bladder infection. The staff were absolutely brilliant. They assessed the situation speedily, contacted the urology department to agree a course of treatment and implemented the recommendations efficiently and sympathetically. Special thanks to the receptionist, the three nurses and the GP who treated me. Extra thanks to the receptionist and one particular nurse for their ongoing help and advice over the following week.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: Have been with Sutterton Surgery for twenty years now, and their caring and helpfulness has never changed. I have always been greeted by a friendly face and nothing is too much trouble. I couldn't wish for a better practice. Well, done, Sutterton!

title: Great
body: Excellent. Fabulous doctors who really care. Go out of there way to listen, calm, reassure and refer if necessary very quickly. The whole practice follows same ethos.

title: Dedicated Staff
body: My husband suffers from C O P D, we always have excellent service and usually get an appointment on the day if required, we have been with the practice for over 40 years and can not fault the service, one of the receptionist is very helpful

author: cygnusyj53
title: Family support
body: If I had known about this service earlier it would have helped me to manage my child's behaviour sooner. This support has helped me to manage my child's behaviour and his diet.

author: DLH
title: Lack of pain relief
body: No pain relief given, though I requested several times. Had a operation with 6 pins put in hand and sent home with no pain relief, currently in a lot of pain

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: 2403scan
title: First-class treatment
body:
I had an ultrasound scan yesterday at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary Outpatient Radiology. All the NHS staff I came into contact with at the hospital were pleasant and helpful. The Radiologist, Lynne, was excellent, treating me with consideration and explaining the results clearly.  
The treatment I received was first-class and it is very much appreciated.

author: patients dad
title: They always excel
body: I had been terrified to call the GP practice during the COVID-19 pandemic but with my daughter showing all the signs of a UTI, I had no choice. The phone was answered promptly and politely. I left details with the receptionist and Dr Box called back with 10 minutes. He took details, prescribed treatment. This all took place around 17: 00 and the local pharmacy (which is usually chaotic) dispensed medicines by 17: 30. I can’t praise Linlithgow Medical Practice enough, they always excel.

author: Relieved family
title: The staff have been amazing
body: A relative has been on Ward B12 at the Forth Valley hospital for nearly 6 months, originally admitted with an infection he has been waiting all this time for a suitable social care package to be found, this proved very difficult as he has a long term condition and has complex needs. Eventually the decision was made to transfer him to a residential home. During his stay the staff have been amazing going above and beyond their duty in an effort to keep him safe and as comfortable as possible. He has no relatives or family able to visit and the staff at times even did his washing. A big thank you to all the staff who have looked after him over the last few months. He has now settled in his new home and was seen enjoying a James Bond film with other residents!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: tigerym64
title: Well looked after on 23 hour ward Ward 1A
body:
My girl, me and her Granma were  
so well looked after from the moment we arrived till we left the next day. We can’t thank you enough.

author: Da-49
title: The team are incredible
body:
I wish I had found this site before! Approximately 2 year's ago my husband had to call NHS 24 and the Nurse who came and the ambulance people were wonderful, so my husband told me because I can't remember! I was taken to Ward 7c at Raigmore Hospital and was shocked at how short staffed they were but saying that, the treatment I received from the Nurses and the Junior Dr.s was wonderful but I have a new hero and that is Thoracic Consultant, Dr. Paterson who found when he looked at my Xray, that there was a shadow area. He organised for me to have a biopsy and scans and I was diagnosed with Adenocarcinoma in the top lobe of my right lung. Dr. Paterson then organised for me to have a Lobectomy at the Golden Jubilee Hospital in Glasgow which was also, mostly, amazing. A wonderful Surgeon!  
I cannot thank Dr. Paterson's team enough because they are incredible and as for Dr. Paterson, he was so kind and he saved my life where another department had missed diagnosing the tumour. I will never, ever forget his kindness and his dedication and I hope that Raigmore treasure him because it's rare, I have found, to have a Consultant who listens to what you are saying and how you feel. A wonderful Dr. and a wonderful team and it feels so inadequate to say thank you but thank you so, so much. I would also like to wish all the NHS Staff at Raigmore and all through Scotland and Britain all the very best wishes. I think you are ALL so brave and thank you so much for all that you do. Good luck, take care and please be safe and know how much we care about you all. Dr. Paterson and the team, please take care and be very safe.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: Mummypie
title: My sons delayed speech and suspected autism
body:
After my sons 2 year review I was told about the classes at our local children’s centre and that they could help with his speech, he is only saying 1 word at this point and just babbling the rest of the time.  
I went along and straight away felt comfortable being there and talking to the girls, they have so much help and advice to offer, not long after I had a call from Charlotte the home talk worker. We had our first session and a referral to SLT was made.  
Charlotte was brilliant and listened to everything I had to say, I had my concerns about my son and his lack of communication along with certain behaviours and social struggles. Charlotte made it possible for me to open up about everything and help me to get the right support. I truly believe that if it wasn’t for Charlotte and the children’s centre we wouldn’t be where we are now.  
I’ve gone from feeling like I’m overreacting about it all and completely on my own to feeling like I’m doing the right thing and I have support. After doing a getting to know he form we are now waiting to be seen by the paediatrician. It’s not been a straight forward time but honestly Charlotte and the team have made it that bit easier to handle. I think people underestimate the help and support available at the children’s centres.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: thubantz36
title: Brilliant service
body:
Helped with strategies and methods that will equip us for the future! Fantastic, couldn't ask for more, improvements clear to see.  
Simple and effective, great examples which have been very effective.  
Helped bring love and a stable home for a challenging little boy, Forever grateful.  
Please pass on this message to many more parents in need of simple tips that can change your life for the better.  
Brilliant service.

author: inclusionby69
title: It's never too late to change your life!
body:
• Truly care for you  
• Feel valued  
• Approachable  
• Kind but firm  
• Proactive  
• Professional  
• More than just service providers  
• Gave me hope and courage  
• Immense knowledge & experience  
• Mental health support  
• Non-judgmental  
• Ongoing support & aftercare  
• It's never too late to change your life!

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: Headachy
title: An excellent experience
body:
After a weekend of severe headaches I contacted my GP for an appointment, only to be told to call for an ambulance, which I did. We were given an approximate timeframe but subsequently called and asked if possible to make our own way to The Royal Cornwall hospital, which we did.  
Dropped off at the main entrance, I sat and waited whilst my husband parked. Clearly unwell, a member of the reception team immediately came over and got a wheelchair ready. We were directed to Minors and staff when out of their way to help at busy lifts.  
Registration was friendly and straightforward and when I was seen by the team they took w thorough history and explained what they would do next. Bloods kindly taken (always hard to find a vein) and the CT scan followed quite quickly. Someone let me know of a slight delay because of a wait for a test result and when I saw the team again there had been a shift change. The new team rechecked my history and explained that although all the results were good, given my age and how the headaches started, they would like to do a lumber puncture in addition. To my surprise, they hope to be able to complete it that evening so if clear I could go home.  
Shortly after a move to the treatment area (near the discharge lounge). I doctor was found shortly after to undertake the lumber puncture. I was given a clear explanation and the option of my husband joining me, which he did. Part of the explanation included that sometimes it is difficult to draw fluid – which it was in my case. A second doctor was called. Both maintained a relaxed and appropriately light-hearted approach whilst the second (and successful) attempt was made, and they ensured I was comfortable and confident throughout.  
There was quite a long wait for the results as lab teams were smaller in the evenings, but I was pre-warned of this and given progress updates. Refreshments and sandwiches were made available of us, and the other 6-8 people in the treatment lounge area. Throughout we noticed all patients were being regularly updated and helped as needed  
Given clear results – my bad headaches where just that – but staff also give me advice to follow up with my GP if they continued.  
An excellent experience and my thanks to all of the staff who helped me that day  
Keep safe

author: bonanzape84
title: IRIS team were all lovely
body:
My father was diagnosed with Alzheimer's approx July 2019. After several visits by people (doctors, nurses, Notts County Council, DWP, Ashfield Council, Social Services) my dad finally got carers the IRIS team for a 3 month period.  
They were all lovely, friendly, great timekeepers and really made sure dad was okay.  
Late 2019 my mum was diagnosed with frontal lobe dementia, IRIS team took her on too. She was very troublesome, I couldn't cope with her and the team were an absolute godsend. I would like to thank them for their patience with her, I often left the house in tears after coping with my mum's behavior, incidentally she is now in a care home which is best for everyone.

author: saturnrq95
title: Fantastic service
body:
My family support worker (Tracy) delivers a fantastic service providing very helpful strategies in all areas in a most professional manner.  
My quality of life has improved as a result of Tracy's service.  
I would highly recommend this service to anyone who may benefit.  
My children and I will continue through life in a more positive way from here on in.

author: columbams97
title: Family support
body:
Tracy has supported me to start off with weaning. My son used to eat laying down but with Tracy's support now he is eating in high chair and it is a big change it helped me emotionally and physically as well.  
Tracy also noticed his eyes turning inwards and referred me to opticians and she came along with me to the hospital for appointment and he has been diagnosed for glasses without her I would not noticed at all. Also she noticed behavioural issues and made appointment with health visitor and now he is referred to paediatrician and she referred to play sessions and ideas how to play with him.  
He has been referred to speech and language therapist as well, without Tracy I would not have noticed anything and it would have affected him more. With Tracy's help we could get help early and she supported me emotionally to accept how things are and confidence to manage.  
I don't have words to thank Tracy for the advice, support and help she has done for me and my boy.  
Thank you Tracy.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: greensp43
title: The IRIS team came and rescued the situation
body:
What can I say!!  
I was at my wits end and then the IRIS team (Trevor) came and rescued the situation. I can't thank Trevor enough, he took control of everything, he couldn't have done more. I think that my husband would have died that day but for Trevor calming him down, he was hyperventilating, he was also calming me down.  
A big thank you, your team do a grand job.

author: Da-49
title: I felt that I was being judged
body:
My story is a long one but I will try to keep it brief! I was referred to Raigmore with pain under my right ribs but unfortunately, was sent, firstly for a Sigmoidoscopy where the staff member I saw treated me as though I was a hypochondriac and said that I didn't need the procedure. When I complained about this, it was denied and excuses were made. The Nurses were and are wonderful however.  
Then I was sent to another specialist who sent me for Scans, Colonoscopy etc. and after a year I became angry and asked why they were still looking at the large bowel when I kept complaining about pain under my right ribs and had lost a lot of weight. I felt that the doctors were judging me because I had suffered with anxiety and depression. Long story short, it turned out I had pneumonia and my wonderful Thoracic Consultant found that I had a tumour in my lung. That tumour had shown on a previous Xray 2 year's previously but had been overlooked or ignored!  
I will never, ever trust that department again. I would love beg them to listen to their patients because we know our bodies and are not going to tell lies about our health. I NEVER want to attend there again but unfortunately, my bowel test has now come back positive for blood and I have a large hernia which is causing problems. I was supposed to be going for a colonoscopy which has now been postponed after this awful virus hit, but I don't want to go anyway. Having had cancer and a lobectomy, I have a big decision to make.  
I want to wish all of the worker's in the National Health good luck and I hope they stay safe and the majority of the staff truly are angel's and I want to say thank you so much for all that you do and please keep safe.  
[Unhappy with 'Staff attitude']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: Gingerbeer
title: Wonderful team
body:
As a family friend I had been visiting my friend in St Lukes .  
At this awful time with the spread of the corona virus the wonderful team at St Lukes are special-from the nurses , doctors , social workers , therapists,cleaners, support staff and catering staff looking after the patients and their families in the hospice .  
Each staff member is so special . Thank you for the work you are doing . The staff will still be working in supporting patients and their families in this difficult time and the challenges that will be faced now and in the future with this virus . Be proud of yourselves in this very difficult time and just take care all of you by looking after your health and well being and look after each other.

author: neptunefy63
title: My operation
body:
Before my operation I had a pre-operation which consisted of weighing me, checking my blood pressure and height, etc. They also went over the type of medicine they would use and when and where, It also consisted of the nurse and the person on the day and worries on a scale of 1 to 10 while asking receiving and answering questions which was very helpful, but my nerves were still there as i am very anxious.  
When they finished the pre- operation I was sent home with some leaflets and instructions for what will happen on the day. When it came to the operation day I was completely fine apart from the early hour of 6 am that I had to wake up in the morning to leave at 6.45 am for hospital to get there on time.  
After arriving I was brought up to my room shared with 2 others where multiple doctors and nurses came to talk to me about the procedure. Where I was also revisited by the person that did my pre-operation to see how I was feeling. It got to about afternoon time where I was given a stress ball to keep, not long after I was taken to get put on the anesthetic to help me go to sleep. I was still anxious and felt worse breathing in the air but the nurses and doctors did an amazing job at keeping me calm. When I woke up they where there helping me to wake up and checking I was healthy before taking me back to the room for food and water finally (can't eat before operation).  
Thank you Debbie - play specialist for your help. You are brill.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Wagon
title: All in all excellent service
body: Hi. I had to attend minor injuries at Stoke following a fall. I was seen quickly, and had an x-ray arranged and completed in10 mins. I was given a fracture clinic appt within 2 days. When reviewed at the clinic I was seen on time given clear advice, sent to plaster room for new plaster, which was done very promptly and professionally. All in all excellent service from everyone and done under difficult conditions generated by the Covid19 crisis. Many thanks

author: millimetercz36
title: Helped me realise I'm not alone
body: I have benefit a lot from this group. Hearing other people's stories/journeys has not only helped me but realised I'm not alone. I have felt I could open up to all members of the group, The work Gemma and Sarah put in to helping us achieve my recovery is amazing, thanks guys. I now have the tools to carry on in my recovery.

author: entitlementgj48
title: Confidence to move forward
body: The Family Footprints group has given me the confidence to move forward with my life, it's also helped with coping mechanisms, breathing exercises. Without this group I don't think I'd be where I am now. Thank you so much to both Sarah and Gemma.

author: mataryz97
title: Happy with the service
body: I'm really happy with Inclusion and what I got from the services, new ways to cope instead of using.   I really enjoy coming to my course's at Inclusion.

author: aurigacr85
title: A help to my recovery
body:
Family footprints has been a help to my recovery and have enjoyed it and other inclusion activities.  
I think that a projector would come in handy rather than having to read from paper.

author: Please help me sleep and walk again
title: I have never been offered additional help
body: I am one of many people with osteoarthritis I have been waiting since October 2018 for a hip replacement which I was told I needed right away. This was over a year ago. I went for my third pre op recently which I passed but now I have been told there is no date in the near future for surgery, I do know this Coronavirus is a terrible thing that has happened through out the world and I can understand why operations are being stopped as I am classed as non-urgent, but I am in terrible pain all the time, can’t have a nights sleep, in a wheelchair now, find it difficult to go to the bathroom.I have had no quality of life for such a long time now, I was always an active person and for the past year and a half I have not had any kind of life, this has also affected my family really badly, I did not think I could live with such pain but I have - the struggle is getting worse every day, the NHS Glasgow and Clyde have never offered me any kind of additional help, just been told there is a waiting list and people in front of me. Makes me feel that it does not matter how much pain I am in, I have just to go away and accept it. I know my body can’t take much more of this pain and suffering. Everyone stay safe and keep well.

author: Gobsmaked
title: Not satisfied with the care received
body:
This company took over the care of my Dad around a year ago, this was to wash and dress him in the morning and get him ready for bed in the evening. This was supposed to help my mum, as my Dad needs 24 hour care, so far all they have caused is stress and upset.  
The things we have had to complain about we found totally unbelievable for example. One worker would finish their work and whilst the other worker wrote in the notes, they would stand at the front door smoking and throwing butt ends around. I would then visit my mum and the house would smell of smoke, my Dad has asthma.  
This worker also thinks it's acceptable to throw a can of deodorant across my parents living room, when asked not to on several occasions they reply that they throw it gently!  
We have found that the workers have in the past written false times in my Dads Notes, stating they were at My parents house when they weren't.  
One worker arrived at my parents house and whilst looking at my Dad said more than once-is it ready. When my Mum asked was what ready, the worker pointed at my Dad. My Dad is a person not an "it".  
This list goes on and on, we have complained to management but feel we are not listened to. in fact the last conversation resulting in me getting really angry, we don't need to be fighting a battle with a care company, my Dad is dying we have enough to be dealing with as his health deteriorates.  
Our next steps are an official complaint, through Sheffield city council and quality care commission.

author: Greystones gal
title: Excellent care from all members of the team
body:
I am so impressed that despite the current challenges, your team are continuing to be as respectful, professional and caring as ever.  
I have been treated with respect by all staff members: admin staff, doctors and nurses.  
This makes a huge difference because it builds trust and means that I feel comfortable being open and honest with the team.  
It also empowers me to make positive changes and look after my own health.Thank you for all that you do for the patients and the local community.You make a huge positive difference to our lives and I am very grateful for you.

author: DJOHNV
title: Recent emergency admission
body:
Visited GP with Pains in my chest who prompty medicated me with Asprin and Nitroglycerin spray as suspected a heart attack. At the same time arranged for an ambulance to take me to Lincoln County Hospital to be assessed further. Also while waiting did an ECG to take with me. The ambulance arrived promptly and took me to the hospital.  
Once there I was assessed very quickly and admitted for further observations overnight.  
Throughout I found the staff were excellent in my dealings with them. They were courteous and respectful even when busy. I felt looked after and cared for. I found the ward I was admitted to MEAU A and Subsequently MEAU B were immaculate.  
I was assessed further by the Cardiology team and appropriately treated and efficiently discharged. The food and refreshments were very welcome from A & E and both wards I was admitted to.  
Despite both the worldwide and Lincoln County Hospitals preparations for the Coronavirus pressures which they coped with admirably, I would recommend this hospital to any of my friends and relatives.

title: Useless
body: Have coronavirus.having problems breathing.been calling 111 been on hold more than 2 hours.nobody answers.have to keep disconnecting.rang so many times.very bad nhs

author: Bill123
title: They have not answered
body:
I have contacted Mid Essex CCG on numerous occasions asking for information.on secondary care mental health services they have commissioning contracts with.  
However, so far they have not answered my questions on what choices are available in secondary care outpatients.  
I have chased the CCG on a number of occasions with no success so far

author: c-56574
title: I was told that a doctor would ring back
body: My medication for Rhuematoid Arthritisis is an immune suppressant. I am experiencing a very bad flare up in my feet, ankles, neck shoulder and hands. I can hardly move. I tried to ring the surgery to ask advice and if I am currently classed as vulnerable due to medication I'm taking. I was told that a doctor would ring me back. This was a week ago and still no call, and I can't get through to the Rheumatology clinic either. What am I supposed to do? I feel abandoned. I have been with this practice since I was born 60 years ago but things have gone from bad to worse since they took over other practices.

author: warmxw55
title: My journey with Inclusion
body:
My Journey @ Inclusion Basingstoke  
Started with: FEAR  
had feelings of:  
STUCK = ADDICTED = DEPRESSED = CONFUSED = ISOLATED = HOPELESS = EMPTY  
Worked towards: Love  
which led to:  
PROGRESSING = WHOLE = CONTENTED = CLARITY = CONNECTED = OPTIMISTIC = FULFILLED  
Attending groups and receiving support from Inclusion Basingstoke has transformed my ability to cope with internal feelings, old and new, and cope with external circumstances, reacting objectively with a newfound wisdom. I have learnt a great deal about myself, enabling me to better cater my lifestyle to my unique set of needs and abilities, thus wholesomely filling the voids in my existence which I have previously addressed by using drugs. I have consistently been made to feel welcome at Inclusion, staff are always helpful and willing to offer support whenever I walk through the door. I now feel confident about my drug-free future and feel empowered to fulfill my potential in all areas of my life.  
I’d like to take this opportunity to thank and congratulate the facilitator of the IRP Core group, he was first class, wise, empathetic, caring, confident, enlightening, dedicated and inspiring.  
He fostered an environment conducive to sharing and growing as people and was always flexible in his approach to cater to user’s needs and circumstances.

author: BMW 63
title: Enlarged Prostate Gland
body:
I would like to thank all Doctors, Nurses, Catering and Domestic staff for the  
excellent care I received at Perth Royal Infirmary.  
At the end of January 2020 I was admitted to Ward 7 for an operation to trim part of my enlarged prostate gland which was causing me problems for passing urine.  
From the minute I stepped into hospital I was kept well informed by Doctors about my treatment and Anesthetic to be used.  
After Operation I was well looked after by Nurses who could not have done enough for my wellbeing.  
I was also well fed and I would like to thank catering staff for that.  
I would also like to thank Consultants for their treatment and understanding on various appointments on lead up to my Operation.

title: Difficult ot get appointment
body: I find it difficult to get evening appointment. Most of the appointment are available between 9-4pm. Usually have to wait 1-2 weeks to get appointment.

title: poor errors and service
body: from end of January, till today 26 March,  I am still waiting for my Spirometry test, very disappointing service and concern.

author: Peacefulspace
title: Video call with doctor
body:
Just had a video consultation on my iPhone with my own doctor and all I can say is that it was excellent. It was really clear, he could see me and my ailments and I could see and hear him clearly! It was like being sat in the surgery with him. Recommend if you need to see and speak to a doctor!  
He sent me the link, which I downloaded, followed the instructions which were easy and success! The doctor was there!

title: The best practice
body:
I have been going there since 2012 and every time i m more than happy with the quality service starting from the wonderful receptionists to the great nurses up to the doctors who are really good listeners and very understanding and the most  important thing is that ,they are very trustworthy and very professional .
I wish them all ,all the best and chapeau bas for all of them and how lucky we are to have them .
A very big thank you from my heart to you and all my gratitude to all of you .

title: Let down
body: Having waited three times for an op ..came today ..day surgery not open at all my app was 7.15am...phoned yesterday to check if it was still on .nobody got bk to me to tell me yes or no ..only priority ops but I was on the urgent list .so just turned up ..managed to speak to pre admissions whilst waiting like an idiot who said it was the consultants secretory who does the booking .phone her ..why on earth wasn't I told yesterday I was not on the list.  Full stop for today ...and sent for bloods on Mon 23rd ....awaiting an explanation now ..I understand what's going on with this coronavirus but comuncation is also important ...so I'm awaiting a call to explain and left .upset and frustrated .. I used to put my trust in this hospital .now I'm losing faith in ever gettin my op ..from last Oct ...still awaiting another op date  as well from Oct

title: Poor practice
body: Every time I have gone in I have left unsatisfied, due to poor reception staff who are not helpful and leave me with more questions than answers. Look me a month to finally register with them whilst I’m at the university. Very had to make an appointment and they couldn’t help me set up online ordering for my repeat medication then when I put it in the order box it was not ordered a week after and I am now running low. They have seriously understaffed telephone lines with over 10 callers ahead of me every time I ring. There is little I can do about changing due to the lack of practises in Lancaster and me being at university there

title: Caring staff
body: I am very grateful for what Eastglade and Monday group have done for me in 2020.  They have worked together when I needed help and I believe this has prevented me from ending up in hospital as a recently.  I feel cared for but also empowered by the recent support they have given this year.  I feel that I am being listened too more about the medication and I feel like I have more of a voice.  Although I am still struggling with my mood disorder thanks to having help I feel like more a person again.  Last year 2019 I did not have enough support from Eastglade and I feel like I was stuck in a loop.  I cannot predict the future but at the moment I have hope.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care for complex needs
body: Father in law has COPD, advanced Dementia, paper skin and heart problems. We are always concerned when he goes into hospital as he can get very confused and distressed. But the care was amazing, really top notch. He went back to the nursing home without bed sores, his breathing back to his normal and importantly he was not distressed by being out of his home. With all that's going on, Tilney Ward and Terrington Ward left us without any feelings of concern and we were very impressed by the consultants care and the attention of the nursing staff. Truly we are very thankful.

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust
